headline: 5 days works but 7-10 days is optimal for first safaris
summary: A 5-day safari is viable and will deliver meaningful wildlife experiences. However, 7-10 days allows for more relaxed pacing, recovery from jet lag, and better odds of specific sightings. Each additional day increases chances of seeing elusive species. For first-time travelers, 7 days is the sweet spot between value and experience.

assumptions.text: 5 days of safari provides meaningful wildlife experiences for most travelers.
Each additional day increases odds of specific or rare sightings.
Long-haul travelers benefit from extra days for jet lag recovery.

gains: Longer trips: Better odds of rare sightings
Shorter trips: Fits limited vacation time
losses: Longer trips: May experience some repetition

change_conditions: If specific sightings are essential, extend trip to improve odds.
If budget is fixed, 5 quality days beats 10 budget days.
If jet lag is a concern, add buffer days before safari begins.
If combining with beach or other activities, 5-7 safari days may suffice.
